AL_exiledguard_bounty0.job_description:
A rare bounty has been put out by the ==Exiled Outpost==, targeting a particular pirate warband that has been active since the ==Night Watch's Blunder==.
 As per the bounty posting, that fleet's commander, ==$name==, personally sank a large number of Night's Watch ships during the Blunder: including the C.O.C., the predecessor of the current IWTGFS, as well as another Night's Watch mainstay, the Landsor.
 It's by sheer coincidence that the Exile Outpost got information on their latest activity; and are rather confident that they will not leave the ==$system== system any time soon, there's some valuable opportunity or other they don't want to miss out on. Maybe this bounty is worth taking, whether to garner favor with the Exile Outpost or making a quick buck; not a bad deal at all.
AL_exiledguard_bounty0.job_comm_reply: "Damn! How did anyone know I was here?"
AL_exiledguard_bounty0.job_intel_success: After the battle has been completed, you find that in addition to the promised reward in credits, you've received a message from an unknown sender, tied to an encrypted network ID. The message reads: "Thank you, my friend. This is a Cyber Platinum commerative work, obscure lore of the Syndicate: got it from Roland, cherish it."
AL_exiledguard_bounty0.job_intel_expired: You ended up not taking out that fleet, and they left the designated area. Interestingly, they don't seem to have survived for long; they were taken out by another eager mercenary on a resupply run to a pirate station in the Core Worlds: it's rumored that mercenary was the famous Bob Roland.

ALP_maddy_bounty.job_description:
A personal bounty has been posted by a one Samuel Joseph, well-known in the Appro-Light Council as the "Hand of Time". According to the bounty posting, a female Originem clone by the name of ==$name== went berserk, stealing an experimental destroyer stored in a private hangar, leading a group of Appro-Light rebels on the run. Although such ships already have limited production, their unstable systems could lead to mass civilian casualties under the control of an amateur captain. 
Joseph doesn't want the officials to be alerted to this, hence the bounty. The destroyer is very intriguing; perhaps it's wortwhile to try and take them on? 
After some surveying, they seem to be lingering in the ==$system== system.
ALP_maddy_bounty.job_comm_reply: Fight! Fight! Maddy will... follow their heart!
ALP_maddy_bounty.job_intel_success: After the battle has concluded, you receive a strange, untraceable message. The first half consists of a woman's voice whispering, too quietly to discern what is being said; the second half is what sounds like pompous religious music played on an organ.
ALP_maddy_bounty.job_intel_expired: Too much time has passed; the runaways have vanished.

ALP_sancta_bounty.job_description:
A public bounty has been put out by the upper echelons of the Appro-Light Council, with remorse and hatred being apparent if you read between the lines. The target is a Luddic Path fleet, led by an Originem clone (of all things) named ==$name==. 
Your own intelligence officers have informed you that the clone was once part of a group composed of victims of religious violence; the clone joined the group out of both sympathy and empathy. The group prized the clone, who was a fleet commander by design, and invited ==$name== to join them in their quest for revenge. However, some years later, the clone stole some of their secret research and slaughtered several innocent members of the group. The group's former staff who have become Appro-Light officials now seek revenge on the Avengers. 
They should be hard at work in the ==$system== system currently.
ALP_sancta_bounty.job_intel_success: After the battle, the Appro-Light officials who posted the bounty privately thanked you, sobbing all the while.
ALP_sancta_bounty.job_intel_expired: Too much time has passed; the fleet has been lost, and there's no telling which planet will be "christened" next.
